What are the original 1.0.0 aerodynamic paramaters? They were fine and 1.0.2's are way too draggy, especially with the ISP nerfs. It takes ALL the fun out of KSP. If I wanted realism I'd play orbiter. :/

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-15T01:10:58Z" title="05/15/2015 01:10  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 15, 2015</time> by waterlubber**

So you're asking for more realistic drag values because...you don't like realism? K. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

[Here you go](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/118633-1-0-Aerodynamics)
I find it more fun when something is harder to achive. But everyone has their own style, there's no accounting for taste.

> 
> So you're asking for more realistic drag values because...you don't like realism?]

There is nothing at all realistic about putting an Earth-like atmosphere on a toy-sized planet that can't possibly have such a thing under the laws of physics we know. Therefore, there is nothing at all unrealistic about making said atmosphere whatever the user desires.

BTW, thanks for the data ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks! Yeah, the 1.0.2 aero does seem *right* for KSP. Rockets fall over too easily. This makes waterlubber a sad panda. I want the difficulty to be in the upper stage, not getting it off kerbin ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
